entry.title: Daniel Hollands
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Daniel Hollands set up Birmingham.IO as a discussion forum and umbrella to contain many projects related to the Birmingham tech scene.

entry.title: Longbridge Open Device Lab
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Anthony Chaffey of web development agency Ballyhoo talks about how they've set up the first Open Device Lab in the Midlands inside Longbridge Innovation Centre and how developers and companies can use it and contribute to it.

entry.title: Mark Steadman
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Steadman is the founder of the poddle.fm podcasting network and Nymbol, a CMS for cultural institutions which integrates beacons.

entry.title: Dan Rice
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Dan Rice is the co-founder of Hobzy, the company behind Handmake.me, the bespoke gift marketplace for crafters and makers.

entry.title: Leigh Purnell
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Leigh Purnell is founder of Petalite Battery, who are launching a crowdfunding campaign for their new external phone battery which charges in fifteen minutes.

entry.title: Dave Evans
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Dave Evans: serial entrepreneur, .NET expert, and head of the nascent Xamarin user group in Birmingham.

entry.title: Ian Harrison
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Ian Harrison, co-curator of TEDxBrum, an independent TEDx event with a theme of "DIY" on November 8th 2014 at the Library of Birmingham.

entry.title: Matthew Somerville
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Matthew Somerville, programmer for MySociety and founder of traintimes.org.uk and Theatricalia.

entry.title: Ryan Dean-Corke
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Ryan Dean-Corke, designer for McCann Birmingham, formerly of SubStrakt, and part of the Good For Nothing Birmingham project.

entry.title: Susannah Goh
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Susannah Goh, Innovative Health and Digital Media lead at Birmingham Science City, chair of the Open Data Forum, and skateboarder.

entry.title: Andy Higgs
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Andy Higgs, co-founder of the Badego design group and Akkroo.

entry.title: Jess Rose
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Jess Rose, founder of Birmingham Open Code and Ladies Who Code Birmingham.

entry.title: Bruce Lawson
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. This discussion is with Bruce Lawson, open standards advocate for the Opera web browser.

entry.title: Simon Jenner
entry.summary: The Brum Tech Scene Interviews are a series of video conversations with interesting and enlightening people involved with technology in some way in Birmingham. Our inaugural interview is with Simon Jenner, head of Oxygen Startups and co-founder of Silicon Canal.

entry.title: Stuart Langridge
entry.summary: An introduction to the Brum Tech Scene interviews, by Stuart Langridge.
